metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8666 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The IP stack in the Linux kernel before 4.6 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (stack consumption and panic) or possibly haveunspecified other impact by triggering use of the GRO path for packets withtunnel stacking, as demonstrated by interleaved IPv4 headers and GREheaders, a related issue to CVE-2016-7039.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-98.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.19.0-71-generic - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-98.145').
